name: places/ChIJIz_Oq1JYwokRPPD6b1C7i64
formattedAddress: 411 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA
adrFormatAddress: 411 W 39th St, New York, NY 10018, USA

editorialSummary.text: Members-only gym offering beginner-oriented fitness classes in a quirky, inclusive atmosphere.

originalText.text:
Mark Fisher Fitness is life changing. There’s no other way to describe it. I had spent years and years going to gyms, trying to get fit, trying to develop a routine. And nothing ever stuck.  Then a friend convinced me to try Mark Fisher Fitness. I’ve never looked back.

The clubhouse, trainers, staff, and other class takers couldn’t be more welcoming and friendly. The idea of a kettlebell workout can be intimidating, but everyone there is so supportive and helpful that all fears quickly melt away. The classes are challenging, but always fun. I always get a great workout, and always laugh throughout. I feel strong, healthy, and happy.  And now if I have to miss a workout I’m bummed.

I cannot recommend trying out Mark Fisher Fitness more. I’d give it 10 stars out of 5 if possible. If you’re wanting to make a change, and gyms are intimidating to you (as they were and still are to me), give Mark Fisher Fitness a try.  You won’t regret it.

originalText.text:
The people in this gym are amazing! I have had a lifelong struggle with exercise (still do) but it has been greatly improved by my experience at Mark Fisher Fitness. I am no longer as resistant to exercising and getting fit as I once was.

They are a great bunch of people who can modify exercises according to your needs. They also challenge you to do better if they feel that you can do better. There is also no stress if you feel that you can't do the exercise; you do what feels best for your body and if you want, you can leave early and try it again next time. They even offer great tips to help with the recovery time. Their emphasis on safety and attention to detail is A+. Fantastic people all around!

originalText.text: I joined Mark Fisher Fitness when they began the Homebody program over the pandemic. I found their trainers enthusiastic, knowledgeable, thorough, compassionate, and truly interested in working with the members. I had just come from working a personal trainer who had no interest in doing online and it was like night and day. MFF session are full of humor, whimsy, and aim towards making the session fun and inclusive of all member's identities and body types. I felt like I belonged.

originalText.text: As my 9 year Mark Fisher Fitness anniversary approaches, I find myself thinking...9 years at a gym?! I never could have dreamed of feeling so at home with fitness but this place, and these people, are beyond extraordinary. Even on days when I don't want to workout, I want to be there. I move my body and feel great every time. I have learned so much over these years. I'm grateful for every moment I'm there and for how great I feel in my life between my visits!

originalText.text: Mark Fisher Fitness is a gem nestled in the heart of Hell's Kitchen. In non-pandemic times, their in-person classes are incredible workouts and foster an amazing sense of community. They've pivoted to an online format for classes (Homebody), which has truly been a lifeline over the past year. Some of the best coaching of my life has happened there during semi-private training sessions, which they're still doing (SAFELY)! I would not be the person I am today without this gym, and how many people can say that about their gym?
